jobs.description:
Amazon Leo is an initiative to increase global broadband access through a constellation of 3,236 satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO). Its mission is to bring fast, affordable broadband to unserved and underserved communities around the world. Project Kuiper will help close the digital divide by delivering fast, affordable broadband to a wide range of customers, including consumers, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in places without reliable connectivity.

Export Control Requirement: Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

We're looking for a Senior Structural/Mechanical Engineer with a background in space vehicle designs and electro-mechanical systems integration. The ideal candidate has experience making major optimization trades for satellite bus architectures including integration with payload subsystems. This is a hands-on role for a highly collaborative individual that combines superb technical and analytical capabilities to convert analytic trade studies to a qualified physical vehicle, while optimizing for high volume production and meeting cross discipline requirements. The candidate will design, analyze, and test satellite primary and secondary structures while ensuring all requirements are met.

Key job responsibilities
- Perform mechanical design and layout trade studies for satellite primary structure contributing to overall system architecture including inputs and requirements from cross discipline teams - Electrical, RF, Thermal, Dynamics, Mechanisms, Materials, Manufacturing, Assembly, and Test.
- Generate detailed designs via CAD systems and engineering drawings with appropriate geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T)
- Conduct or oversee static, dynamic and modal structural analysis via finite element methods as needed to support design work.
- Deliver an efficient structural design capable of high volume production throughput (DFMA)
- Documentation and presentation of materials for technical design reviews
- Design and support test campaigns, both development and qualification/acceptance, for space hardware

そんな挑みがいのあるミッションに、あなたの経験を活かしてみませんか。

■配送管理
入荷した商品の仕分け・出荷作業および配送ルートの計画を立案します。
“どのアイテムを、いつ、何人で仕分けするか”、“どの地域に、どのような順番で配送するか”などをプランニングします。

仕分けや出荷、配送などを担うスタッフの管理業務です。
人員は数十名。
物流量に合わせてシフトを組むほか、業務がスムーズに進捗しているかなどを管理します。
シフト調整を担当するアシスタントスタッフ（3～4名）と連携し、状況把握や指示出しなどを行います。
業務管理は社内システムで行います。

安全・品質・生産性向上や業務効率化などを実現するための業務です。
業務フローや業務環境、作業内容などにおける問題を見つけ、改善案やその実施計画を立案します。
シニアエリアマネージャーとは定期的に業務改善のミーティングをするため、積極的に意見を出しあいます。

jobs.description:
The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Talent Acquisition team is seeking a talented, customer-focused Recruiter to join their team.

As a Recruiter at AWS, you'll spearhead candidate generation initiatives in collaboration with hiring managers across diverse roles in Australia. Your mission is to uncover, engage, and evaluate top-tier talent, leveraging your innovation and creativity with attraction strategies. At AWS, we embrace all ideas, fostering an environment where innovation counts. You will be part of a collaborative environment with dedicated business leaders that are fully committed to the recruitment journey.

Surrounded by a group of exceptional recruiters ready to dive in and deliver great results, you'll thrive in an environment that values ownership and action. You'll leverage your deep understanding of the technology landscape or other fast-paced industry to cultivate trusting connections with hiring managers, recruiters, and candidates.

This position is for a 12 month fixed term period.

Key job responsibilities
• Work closely with business in order to deeply understand the roles and responsibilities, and utilise this information to develop effective recruiting strategies.
• Build and maintain network of potential candidates through proactive market research and on-going relationship management, gauging candidates for cultural alignment and motivation rather than simply ‘sell a role’.
• Ensure all sourcing channels are sufficiently utilised, including but not limited to employee referrals, internal CRM, career portals, job fairs, etc.
• Be a subject matter expert on the talent market and offer ideas and strategies related that will contribute to the long-range talent landscape.
• Implement new processes and fine-tuning standard processes for recruiting that fits within Amazon's mission to deliver the highest quality results to the customer.
• Active participation in the recruitment efforts, including emphasis on the capability of assessing skills to help evaluate candidates and ensuring the highest bar.
• Manage well on all the data associated with the recruitment process. Data-driven thinking and systematic approaches in achieving the operation excellence.
• Emphasis on continuous improvement, as such it is expected that you will spend time to ensure ongoing education of hiring managers and interviews on recruitment “best practice” and interview skills training.

jobs.description:
At Amazon we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. Towards this, Amazon Global Logistics (AGL) is working to enable the largest selection of inventory on earth for our customers. AGL's vision is to build Amazon's global logistics pipeline for any supplier to supply to any location in the world. AGL offers inter-continental logistics services to selling partners to enable them to move their product from an origin country to Amazon fulfillment centers. AGL is also responsible for exports from fulfillment centers to other countries outside of the fulfillment network. AGL enables global expansion for the selling partners with the highest standard of quality, accountability, and transparency.

AGL team is building cross border logistics solutions which eliminate borders between buyers and sellers. These solutions enable the third-party sellers to import or export their products across borders, thereby expand their business into new markets and get access to the customers around the world. Amazon is driving this multi-year vision to create new logistical benchmarks and "firsts" through disruptive innovation.


We need talented people to build highly-available, scalable distributed systems that provide clean interfaces between sellers, shippers, trade agents and customs authorities to ship their products to the customers around the world. If you are excited by the opportunity to lead a high performing engineering team in the design and development of this AGL solution, this is the right career move for you! We operate as a startup within Amazon, providing great flexibility in product and technology direction.

As a leader on the team, you will be expected to operate at all levels, diving deep into the details while providing strategic inputs for the product. You will be a key player in driving strategic planning, project execution, hiring and development of engineering talent, driving operational excellence, and shaping up the solutions to achieve our vision. This is your opportunity to make a big impact and make history in the world of global logistics!

Responsibilities:
• Lead an engineering team that will build, operate and maintain software in order to meet business needs
• Hire, coach, and mentor individuals
• Interface with a diverse customer base to understand requirements, priorities, and processes
• Propose and implement new projects or recommend system improvements
• Own all operational metrics and support
• Help develop long-term development and business technology strategies

jobs.description:
Join Amazon Pharmacy's ambitious mission to build a next-generation Pharmacy fulfillment technology that is reshaping healthcare delivery. As a founding member of our new Bangalore team, you'll architect and develop mission-critical fulfillment technology that ensures medication safety for millions while enabling rapid delivery capabilities to scale the business. You'll work on complex distributed systems handling inventory management, order orchestration, and compliance-critical workflows, building from the ground up using Amazon's latest cloud-native technologies and AI/ML capabilities.
The ideal candidate brings systems design experience, expertise in building highly available services, and passion for solving challenging technical problems where quality and compliance are paramount. You'll have the opportunity to integrate with advanced robotics and automation systems, while leveraging AI to optimize delivery speeds, enhance accuracy, and improve operational efficiency.
Amazon Pharmacy is transforming how customers access healthcare by combining Amazon's customer obsession and operational excellence with pharmacy services - making it easier for customers to find, purchase, and receive their medications. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the technical foundation of this rapidly growing business while directly impacting customer healthcare experiences. Your work will be instrumental in scaling Amazon's pharmacy operations and building technology that could fundamentally change how customers access their medications. If you're excited about delivering large-scale systems that require precision while maintaining Amazon-scale performance, we want to talk to you.


Key job responsibilities
A Senior Technical Program Manager at Amazon Pharmacy Operations is responsible for the planning, execution, and successful delivery of complex technical programs that span multiple teams and have significant impact on business goals and customer experience.
This is a strategic role requiring deep technical understanding combined with exceptional program management capabilities.

Key Responsibilities

Program Ownership & Delivery

Own successful delivery of large, impactful, and highly cross-functional programs while simultaneously tracking smaller projects

Scope and deliver complex, business-critical programs end-to-end, shaping the overall program strategy and roadmap
Manage complex initiatives spanning organizations in support of larger business objectives

Technical Leadership

Work directly with engineering teams on architecture decisions and technology strategy

Understand business strategy and technical design approaches within the pharmacy domain
Gather requirements, document functional and design specifications, and identify appropriate resourcing
Solve ambiguous problems and proactively identify risks before they become blockers

Stakeholder Management & Communication

Build bridges among technology, compliance, legal, and security teams

Clearly communicate goals, roles, responsibilities, and desired outcomes across all levels
Influence and optimize processes across teams, driving the right priorities and trade-offs
Engage effectively at both executive and technical levels with superior written and verbal communication skills

Process & Innovation

Champion innovation and continuous improvement, designing novel solutions to empower teams

Make appropriate trade-offs to optimize timelines and deliverables in consultation with stakeholders
Drive best practices, deal with ambiguity and competing objectives
Follow Amazon's Working Backwards methodology, starting with customer and stakeholder needs

About the team
Amazon’s mission is to make it easier for customers to access the healthcare products and services they need to get and stay healthy. Towards this mission, Amazon Pharmacy Fulfillment Tech strives to build technology to fulfill the world’s healthcare needs as fast as possible at the highest quality, lowest cost, and greatest convenience. While our near-term focus is building fulfillment technology to support Amazon Pharmacy, our North Star Vision is to support the fulfillment of any type of healthcare experience at Amazon. To that end, our systems are flexible enough to integrate with other in-house and third-party systems and extensible to accommodate the ever-growing and changing healthcare needs of our customers. Whether it is building our own software or integrating with other in-house and/or third-party services, we strive to leverage the best-in-class technology available to deliver delightful healthcare experiences to Amazon customers, starting with Pharmacy.

jobs.description:
Amazon's Retail Business Services (RBS) Business Excellence team is seeking an exceptional Senior Program Manager to lead the Value Excellence workstream. This role is critical in identifying high-impact underserved areas, creating proof of concepts, and driving programs that deliver extraordinary returns on investment for Amazon and our Selling Partners.

Key job responsibilities
• Lead the Value Excellence workstream to increase Orgs impact and ROI. Aggregate and analyze business metrics to identify opportunities for value creation and ROI improvement

• Translate complex business problems into data-driven solutions with measurable outcomes

You'll lead cross-functional meetings to drive alignment on high-impact initiatives, work with your team to develop proof of concepts, and present ROI analyses to senior leadership. You'll balance multiple programs simultaneously to reduce cost to serve, improve growth and Selling Partner experience. Throughout the day, you'll remove blockers, influence stakeholders, and ensure your programs are on track to deliver extraordinary returns.

jobs.description:
Help shape the future of global logistics at Amazon by driving operational excellence through innovative test automation and quality assurance. In this role, you'll lead the development of sophisticated testing frameworks that ensure the reliability and performance of mission-critical logistics systems serving millions of customers worldwide. Your work will directly impact Amazon's ability to deliver products efficiently and reliably across our global network.

Key job responsibilities
- Design and implement advanced test automation frameworks that scale across multiple platforms and services
- Lead technical initiatives to improve testing infrastructure, methodologies, and tools
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure quality throughout the development lifecycle
- Develop comprehensive testing strategies for complex distributed systems
- Mentor team members and contribute to building a culture of quality engineering

A day in the life
You'll start your day reviewing test results from overnight automation runs and prioritizing critical issues with the development team. Throughout the day, you'll write code for new test frameworks, participate in architecture design reviews, and collaborate with product managers to define quality metrics. You might spend time optimizing performance tests for a new logistics application or mentoring colleagues on best practices in test automation. Your role combines hands-on technical work with strategic quality leadership.

About the team
The Global Logistics Quality Assurance team is passionate about maintaining Amazon's high standards of operational excellence. We focus on developing innovative testing solutions that help deliver millions of packages to customers worldwide. Our team values continuous learning, technical innovation, and collaborative problem-solving. We're building next-generation testing platforms that scale with Amazon's growing logistics network.
